body:
I can't replicate this - it worked just fine when I tried

    rclone mount -vv hubic:default ~/mnt/tmp/

And in another terminal window

    cd ~/mnt/tmp
    wget https://dnd.rem.uz/Advanced%20D%26D%20%28unsorted%29/AD%26D%20Accessory-FR-Volo%E2%80%99s%20Guide%20to%20All%20Things.pdf

Was this just a one-off or can you replicate it at will?
I can. Let me poke at it again.

```jfulmer@localhost:~$ sudo bash
[sudo] password for jfulmer: 
root@localhost:/home/jfulmer# rclone mount -vv hubic:default /storage/test
2017/06/23 12:08:34 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.36" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "-vv" "hubic:default" "/storage/test"]
2017/06/23 12:08:35 DEBUG : Hubic: Got swift credentials (expiry 2017-06-24 18:08:30 +0200 +0200 in 23h59m54.452635801s)
2017/06/23 12:08:35 INFO  : Hubic Swift container default: Modify window is 1ns
2017/06/23 12:08:35 DEBUG : Hubic Swift container default: Mounting on "/storage/test"
2017/06/23 12:08:35 DEBUG : Hubic Swift container default: Root()
^Z

root@localhost:/home/jfulmer#

Documents

2017/06/23 12:08:50 DEBUG : : Dir.ReadDirAll OK with 1 entries
2017/06/23 12:08:50 DEBUG : : Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x
2017/06/23 12:08:50 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.Lookup
2017/06/23 12:08:50 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.Lookup OK
2017/06/23 12:08:50 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x
uments/
root@localhost:/storage/test/Documents# ls
2017/06/23 12:08:51 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.ReadDirAll
2017/06/23 12:08:51 DEBUG : Documents: Reading directory
2017/06/23 12:08:52 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.ReadDirAll OK with 1 entries

root@localhost:/storage/test/Documents# wget https://dnd.rem.uz/Advanced%20D%26D%20%28unsorted%29/AD%26D%20Accessory-FR-Volo%E2%80%99s%20Guide%20to%20All%20Things.pdf
2017/06/23 12:09:02 DEBUG : Documents: Dir.Attr valid=1m0s ino=0 size=0 mode=drwxr-xr-x
2017/06/23 12:09:02 DEBUG : Documents/AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo?%80%99s Guide to All Things.pdf: Dir.Lookup

Length: 8871505 (8.5M) [application/pdf]

Saving to: ‘AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo\342%80%99s Guide to All Things.pdf’

AD&D Accessory-FR-V   0%[                      ]       0  --.-KB/s             2017/06/23 12:09:03 DEBUG : Documents/AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo?%80%99s Guide to All Things.pdf: WriteFileHandle.Write len=106

```

Hmm, that isn't quite what I see - I see the correct character for the quote symbol not \342%80%99.

What is your locale set to? Is it not UTF-8? I don't understand why curl is saving the file name with % signs in instead of using the UTF-8 character.

I guess I can try saving a file with the name exactly as from your log and see what happens. It has invalid UTF-8 characters in so maybe that is what hubic doesn't like.

I should be able to try this on a Debian 8 VM (I tested on Ubuntu)

Yeah, it's supposed to be UTF.

It may be something bad interacting with wget (after all, telling it
not to interpret filenames works fine), but rclone should throw an
error, not just hang, I would think. That's the only reason I bring it
up.

jfulmer@localhost:~$ locale
LANG=en_US.UTF-8
LANGUAGE=
LC_CTYPE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_TIME="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_COLLATE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_PAPER="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_NAME="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_ADDRESS="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_TELEPHONE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MEASUREMENT="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_ALL=

On Fri, Jun 23, 2017 at 12:10 PM, Nick Craig-Wood
<notifications@github.com> wrote:
> Hmm, that isn't quite what I see - I see the correct character for the quote
> symbol not \342%80%99.
>
> What is your locale set to? Is it not UTF-8? I don't understand why curl is
> saving the file name with % signs in instead of using the UTF-8 character.
>
> I guess I can try saving a file with the name exactly as from your log and
> see what happens. It has invalid UTF-8 characters in so maybe that is what
> hubic doesn't like.
>
> I should be able to try this on a Debian 8 VM (I tested on Ubuntu)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

I managed to recreate this by attempting to copy a file I made like this.  This is the troublesome part of your filename above. 

```
$ python
>>> f =open("/tmp/volo/Volo\342%80%99s", "w")
>>> f.write("hello world")
>>> f.close()
```

This will now give this error if you attempt to copy it into the mount rather than hang.

```
2017/06/26 11:35:03 ERROR : volo/Volo�%80%99s: WriteFileHandle.New Put failed: HTTP Error: 412: 412 Precondition Failed
2017/06/26 11:35:03 ERROR : volo/Volo�%80%99s: WriteFileHandle.Write error: io: read/write on closed pipe
```

The problem is that the filename is not a valid UTF-8 string which hubic will reject with a 412 error.

I'm not quite sure why your wget does what it does, but when I try it onUbuntu 17.04 I get a different (much more sensible!) result with a valid UTF-8 filename

```
$ wget https://dnd.rem.uz/Advanced%20D%26D%20%28unsorted%29/AD%26D%20Accessory-FR-Volo%E2%80%99s%20Guide%20to%20All%20Things.pdf
--2017-06-26 12:04:00--  https://dnd.rem.uz/Advanced%20D%26D%20%28unsorted%29/AD%26D%20Accessory-FR-Volo%E2%80%99s%20Guide%20to%20All%20Things.pdf
Resolving dnd.rem.uz (dnd.rem.uz)... 163.172.43.158
Connecting to dnd.rem.uz (dnd.rem.uz)|163.172.43.158|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 8871505 (8.5M) [application/pdf]
Saving to: ‘AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo\’s Guide to All Things.pdf’

AD&D Accessory-FR-V 100%[===================>]   8.46M  5.14MB/s    in 1.6s    

2017-06-26 12:04:02 (5.14 MB/s) - ‘AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo\’s Guide to All Things.pdf’ saved [8871505/8871505]
```

```
$ ls -l AD*
-rw-rw-r-- 1 ncw ncw 8871505 Jun 24  2016 AD&D Accessory-FR-Volo’s Guide to All Things.pdf
```

```
 dpkg -l | grep wget
ii  wget                                        1.18-2ubuntu1                               amd64        retrieves files from the web
```

Anyway, please find a fixed rclone here

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.36-213-gb3605279/  (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

And please reopen if it doesn't fix it for you.
